page.title: 01UPMINSTER: INTRODUCTION 1
page.content: The land cover in our area can be split into two main sections: {Residential and Agricultural. The residential area is the South-East corner of Upminster,and just about includes the town centre.Approximately {80%}of the land,though,is rural.The highest point is on the Eastern edge of the area,and is{41}m. high.There are 12 farms, e.g.{Manor Farm,}an out_ _door pursuits centre on the South side,and three quarries. Most of the area is{superficial clay and below is the London Clay bedrock.The bedrock dips to the{SW}and near{Harwood Hall}it is deep below superficial deposits. This is where sand,and gravel are quarried.There is a bedrock outcrop near{Clay Tye {Farm,and covers about}ten square metres.
